hero.title: FitGN Rail — Modular locking Gastronorm rails
hero.subtitle: FitGN Rail is a modular kit of Gastronorm rails that locks standard GN boxes in place. Lay the rails over any bain-marie or saladette, click the segments together, and every opening stays aligned.
hero.supporting: Build the exact service grid you need with GN 1/1, 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/6, and 1/9 rails that interlock in seconds and hold their geometry through the rush.

problem.title: When rails slip, service slows
problem.body: Loose Gastronorm rails slide, bow, and show asymmetry. Service teams waste time reseating pans, create waste and cleanup when GN boxes fall, and end up frustrated and looking unprofessional — everyone simply "lives with it."

solution.title: Click-lock rails that stay put
solution.body: FitGN Rail retrofits any GN well with stainless rails that mechanically lock together. The click geometry resists vibration, keeps trays perfectly level, and lifts out for easy cleaning — no drilling, no adhesives, just click and done.

features.title: Modular GN layout
features.text: Combine GN 1/1 down to GN 1/9 rails to mirror any mise en place without custom fabrication.

features.title: Rigid thick-gauge inox
features.text: Rails stay stiff so pans never wobble and every well looks dialled in.

features.title: Tool-less retrofit
features.text: Drop the rails in, click them tight, and lift them out for cleaning in seconds.

lineup.title: One kit, every Gastronorm opening
lineup.body: Select the rail segments you need, click them together, and you have a locked grid tailored to your menu — swap layouts as fast as you swap boxes.

sizes.title: GN 1/1
sizes.text: Spans the full opening to form the structural backbone for wide bain-marie or saladette wells.

sizes.title: GN 1/2 · 1/3 · 1/4 · 1/6 · 1/9
sizes.text: Mix and match the smaller rails to snap into the 1/1 spine, creating tight openings for any combination of boxes — everything interlocks without flexing.

about.title: Born from a kitchen problem
about.body: Koen Mortier has operated Fitchen restaurants for over a decade and knows the GN struggle firsthand. After years of searching globally for an off-the-shelf fix, every supplier gave the same answer: there is no solution, kitchens just “live with it.” Pauline De Schepper, your direct contact and a student working shifts at Fitchen, encounters the same issue daily. Together they designed the FitGN Rail to solve it in their own kitchens and make the solution available to others.

steps.title: Drop-in base
steps.text: Set the low-profile GN 1/1 base into the counter opening — no screws, no adhesives.

steps.title: Click the rails
steps.text: Slide each rail until it locks with its neighbour. The grid aligns itself and stays rigid.

steps.title: Service & clean
steps.text: Swap boxes at speed without the rails moving. Unclick the segments when you want to rinse them — they dry fast.

flemish.title: Flemish-built for relentless service
flemish.body: FitGN Rail is engineered and fabricated in Flanders, where dense horeca networks and stainless expertise set a high bar.

pillars.title: Kitchen-grade inox
pillars.text: 304/316 stainless throughout, deburred edges, and weldless joints to meet HACCP standards.

pillars.title: Fabricated in Flanders
pillars.text: Local partners laser-cut and form every rail so we control tolerances down to the smallest detail.

pillars.title: Reliability by design
pillars.text: Rails are stress-tested against vibration and heat cycles so you can focus on service, not hardware.
